docs.snippet: LEAD: IN WHAT SEEMED LIKE A timely tribute to the main architect of this modernistic capital, just a week before Oscar Niemeyer's 80th birthday on Dec. 15, Brasilia was added to Unesco's list of sites that form part of the cultural patrimony of ma...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: IN WHAT SEEMED LIKE A timely tribute to the main architect of this modernistic capital, just a week before Oscar Niemeyer's 80th birthday on Dec. 15, Brasilia was added to Unesco's list of sites that form part of the cultural patrimony of mankind.

headline.main: A City of the Future Grapples With A Troubled Present

docs.snippet: LEAD: PRESIDENT Reagan now has about a year left to work his will on international events, to shape his legacy. But, as he has certainly seen in the last seven years, the capacity to control world affairs from the Oval Office is sorely limited, an...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: PRESIDENT Reagan now has about a year left to work his will on international events, to shape his legacy. But, as he has certainly seen in the last seven years, the capacity to control world affairs from the Oval Office is sorely limited, and the prospects for dramatic accomplishments in the final period seem slim.

headline.main: Reagan's Search for New Year's Diplomatic Resolutions

docs.snippet: LEAD: IT WAS the typical student scramble: Robert E. Vanasek pulled an all-nighter to finish his midterm in Political Management, went to class, and just half an hour before it was due, packed his knapsack and sneaked out to pick up the paper from...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: IT WAS the typical student scramble: Robert E. Vanasek pulled an all-nighter to finish his midterm in Political Management, went to class, and just half an hour before it was due, packed his knapsack and sneaked out to pick up the paper from the typist, barely making it back to class by the deadline.

docs.snippet: LEAD:  'BILOXI BLUES' IN MILLBURN  Neil Simon's ''Biloxi Blues,'' which won a Tony award for best play in 1985, opens Wednesday at the Paper Mill Playhouse in Millburn. It is the middle work in Mr. Simon's semi-autobiographical trilogy, which begi...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: 'BILOXI BLUES' IN MILLBURN Neil Simon's ''Biloxi Blues,'' which won a Tony award for best play in 1985, opens Wednesday at the Paper Mill Playhouse in Millburn. It is the middle work in Mr. Simon's semi-autobiographical trilogy, which begins with ''Brighton Beach Memoirs'' and ends with ''Broadway Bound.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Making resolutions for other people last New Year's had mixed results. I didn't have to worry about keeping my own, which was a relief, but not many of them lived up to the obligation. Maybe I can do better this time. Here are some suggestio...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Making resolutions for other people last New Year's had mixed results. I didn't have to worry about keeping my own, which was a relief, but not many of them lived up to the obligation. Maybe I can do better this time. Here are some suggestions:

docs.snippet: LEAD: Four members of the Puerto Rican independence group FALN, including its leader, were convicted of conspiracy today in a failed attempt in 1986 to free the leader from prison....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Four members of the Puerto Rican independence group FALN, including its leader, were convicted of conspiracy today in a failed attempt in 1986 to free the leader from prison.

headline.main: Four Guilty in Plot to Free Puerto Rican Terrorist

docs.snippet: LEAD: Although few black directors worked in Hollywood until the last 30 years, and histories of American movies rarely even mention such pioneering black filmmakers as Oscar Micheaux and Richard Maurice, black American cinema has a rich -albeit l...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Although few black directors worked in Hollywood until the last 30 years, and histories of American movies rarely even mention such pioneering black filmmakers as Oscar Micheaux and Richard Maurice, black American cinema has a rich -albeit largely unknown - history, according to Pearl Bowser, who has organized a series of works by black directors that begins on Sunday at the Brooklyn Museum.

headline.main: Brooklyn Series to Study Black Images in Film
